text: Nicola Mary Pagett Scott (15 June 1945 – 3 March 2021), known professionally as Nicola Pagett, was a British actress. She was known for her role as Elizabeth Bellamy in the 1970s TV drama series Upstairs, Downstairs (1971–73). Her movie roles include: Anne of the Thousand Days (1969), Operation Daybreak (1975), and An Awfully Big Adventure (1995). Pagett was diagnosed with manic depression in 1997 and became obsessed with the then Prime Minister's chief Press Secretary, Alastair Campbell. Pagett died on 3 March 2021 in London from brain cancer, aged 75. ==References== Category:1945 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Deaths from brain cancer Category:British movie actors Category:British television actors Category:British stage actors Category:British voice actors Category:Actors from Cairo
title: Nicola Pagett
